thread.title: Manchester United news: Dimitar Berbatov wants Premier League return | Metro News
thread.title_full: Manchester United news: Dimitar Berbatov wants Premier League return | Metro News

author: George Bellshaw For Metro.Co.Uk
title: Manchester United news: Dimitar Berbatov wants Premier League return | Metro News
text:
George Bellshaw for Metro.co.uk Wednesday 22 Feb 2017 9:00 am Dimitar Berbatov represented three Premier League clubs including Manchester United (Picture: Getty) 
Dimitar Berbatov has confirmed his plans to return to the Premier League, although he admitted it would be dependent on whether opportunities present themselves. 
The former Manchester United and Tottenham Hotspur star, 36, is currently without a club after leaving Greek side PAOK in 2016. Keep smiling! Mourinho of all people melts hearts with touching message to Ranieri 
Berbatov, who won the Premier League twice as well as the League Cup and Club World Cup at Old Trafford, has been linked with a lucrative move to China and the MLS as he looks for another move at this late stage in his career. 
But the former Premier League Golden Boot winner has revealed he wants to return to England’s top flight. Dimitar Berbatov scored 94 goals in 226 Premier League appearances (Picture: Getty) 
‘As I say, I still feel great,’ he told CNN . ‘I am the same age as the striker you mentioned beforehand, Zlatan [Ibrahimovic], so we’ll see. 
‘I feel good and as long as I feel good I still have desire to play.
